concept.title: Validation
concept.shortdesc: The console provides two types of validation:

dlentry.dd: Logical validation occurs by default as the console saves your changes. Logical validation lists missing or incomplete configuration, such as an unconnected stage or a required property that has not been configured. Logical validation also lists information that uses incorrect syntax, such as the wrong structure for a URI.
Errors found by logical validation display in the Issues list.
Semantic validation occurs on demand when you click the Validate icon. Semantic validation becomes available when logical validation passes.
Semantic validation checks all configured values for validity and verifies whether the pipeline can run as configured.

For example, while logical validation checks for the syntax for a URI, semantic validation tests the URI by connecting to the system. Similarly, while logical validation checks expressions for invalid syntax, semantic validation verifies what's the difference for expressions, or should I use a different example?
